description: Tomoki Yoshihara starts his shift at a meat-processing plant in rural Australia at 5am, and earns three times more butchering lamb for almost 50 hours a week than he did as a member of Japan’s military.
title: Japan’s Young Workers Head Abroad as Huge Wage Gap Persists

description: The victory of South Korea’s main opposition party in parliamentary elections has made its leader a top contender for president in 2027, as long as he can manage a fickle public and stay ahead of a legal battle that could land him in prison before then.
title: Indicted Opposition Leader Is South Korea’s Political Winner

description: Former President Donald Trump offered support for embattled House Speaker Mike Johnson who is fighting to keep his job under pressure from ultraconservative lawmakers, seeking to tamp down on divisions in the Republican caucus.
title: Trump Offers Support for Johnson as He Downplays GOP Divisions

description: Kristalina Georgieva won a second five-year term as the head of the International Monetary Fund, allowing her to continue leading the crisis lender as it confronts challenges including lower global growth prospects, climate change and distressed debt in developing nations.
title: IMF Chief Georgieva Wins Second Term Ahead of Spring Meetings

description: Compact fluorescent light bulbs — once considered corkscrew-shaped emblems of the clean-energy transition — will effectively be phased out under a Biden administration rule finalized Friday that sets new requirements for the most commonly used types of lighting.
title: New Biden Rule Means Lights Out for Compact Fluorescent Bulbs

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Tries Executive Action to Fulfill Campaign Promises

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen warned China’s leaders that the nation’s manufacturing power is a threat to global economic stability. Next week Washington has a chance to rally more countries to its cause.
title: US Set to Ring Alarm Bells Over Chinese Industry on World Stage

description: Artificial intelligence could help cure cancer, ease energy insecurity and reduce poverty – if regulators would just get out of the way.
title: Big Tech’s Call for Light Touch on AI Falls Flat With Enforcers

description: China blasted remarks made by Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida during his visit to the US this week, saying that any “wrong actions” taken by its Asian neighbor will be met with “resolute, necessary responses” from Beijing.
title: China Blasts Kishida, Vows Response to Any ‘Wrong’ Japan Moves

description: China is providing Russia with significant quantities of components to build cruise missiles and drones as well as optical parts for tanks and armored vehicles, allowing Moscow to ramp up defense production in its war against Ukraine, senior US officials said.
title: US Warns China Is Providing Russia With Drone, Missile Components

description: Russian spy agencies have adopted more aggressive tactics in the Baltic region over the past year, including bomb scares, cyberattacks and election interference, the head of Estonian counterintelligence said.
title: Russia Ratchets Up Threat to Baltics, Estonia Spy Chief Says

description: US attempts to press the Netherlands and Japan into further curbing Chinese access to semiconductor technology suffered a setback this week, with both nations seeking time for existing limits to take hold — and to see who triumphs in the US presidential election.
title: US Faces Pushback on More China Chip Curbs as Election Nears

description: Chile’s government is demanding that Venezuela collaborate in the investigation of a murdered refugee amid signs the killing was politically motivated, testing ties between the two nations.
title: Chile Points Finger at Venezuela in Case of Murdered Refugee

description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida sought to highlight his country’s investments in the US with a visit to a Toyota Motor Corp. plant in North Carolina, a crucial battleground state in the 2024 contest between President Joe Biden and Donald Trump.
title: Kishida Touts Japan’s Investments in US With Visit to Swing-State Toyota Plant

description: Energy Minister Graham Stuart quit UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s government as he prepares to face a tight election in the coming months.
title: UK Climate Minister Stands Down Ahead of General Election

description: A Dutch environmental group is pushing for a stricter interpretation of the landmark 2021 court order for Shell Plc to slash its carbon emissions, seeking to turn the company’s appeal of that verdict to its advantage.
title: Shell Climate Appeal Sees Dutch Group Push for Tougher Rules

description: President Joe Biden, who has criticized Republican rival Donald Trump for relying on political donations to pay his legal bills, used nearly $2 million raised by the Democratic National Committee to pay his own lawyers.
title: Like Trump, Biden Used Political Donations to Cover Lawyer Fees

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government will provide low-cost leases of public land to developers and push factory construction of homes as part of what it calls a “historic” plan to alleviate Canada’s housing crisis.
title: Developers to Get Cheap Land Leases in Canadian Homebuilding Push

description: The billionaire Batista brothers’ stunning comeback is thrusting them into Brazil’s highest circles of power less than three weeks after their appointment to the board of JBS SA.
title: Lula Reunites With Billionaire JBS Brothers as Brazil’s China Ties Deepen

description: The UK and Spain said they made “significant progress” toward a deal to settle post-Brexit border arrangements for Gibraltar after talks between British Foreign Secretary David Cameron, his Spanish counterpart and Gibraltar’s chief minister on Friday.
title: UK, Spain Make ‘Significant Progress’ Toward Gibraltar Deal

description: The Netherlands has committed an additional €1.4 billion ($1.5 billion) in support for Ukraine this year as the war-ravaged country pleads for more aid to beat back Russia’s invasion.
title: Dutch Commit an Extra €1.4 Billion in 2024 Support for Ukraine

description: Six months after violent protests rocked Panama, the country’s politicians are on edge and foreign investors are staying away.
title: Panama’s $10 Billion Mine Closure Casts a Shadow Over Election and Bonds

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau swept to power in 2015 with the help of younger Canadians captivated by his positive messaging and socially progressive views. That same group of voters may eventually be his undoing.
title: Young Canadians Squeezed by Housing Turn Away From Trudeau

description: South Africa’s fourth-largest political party envisions the country being led by a “grand coalition” if neither the ruling African National Congress nor an opposition bloc win an outright majority in next month’s elections, and that its leaders will be part of the new cabinet.
title: Opposition Party Envisions ‘Grand Coalition’ Ruling South Africa After Elections

description: UK police reopened a probe into whether deputy Labour Party leader Angela Rayner broke electoral law over information she gave about her living situation before she became an MP.
title: UK Police Probe Whether Starmer No. 2 Rayner Broke Law Over Council House

description: Israel is bracing for a direct and unprecedented attack by Iran on government targets as soon as Saturday, according to people familiar with western intelligence assessments, a move that has the potential to trigger an all-out regional war.
title: Israel Bracing for Potential Direct Attack From Iran in Days

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Treading Water: Thames' Ticking Time Bomb

description: Support for Germany’s AfD dwindled further ahead of June’s European Parliament elections, but Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s three-way ruling coalition is still struggling to eke out any advantage from the far-right party’s woes.
title: German Far-Right Support Dwindles Ahead of European Elections

description: Ghana’s top two contenders for president have denounced homosexuality, without saying if they would sign a draconian antigay bill into law that could have severe repercussions for the nation’s finances.
title: Anti-LGBTQ Bill Becomes Political Hot Potato for Ghana Elections

description: With far-right leader Marine Le Pen’s party’s polling lead for the European elections getting wider, Macron’s team has reason to worry
title: Macron’s Entourage Puts On a Brave Face as It Hits the Campaign Trail

description: Israel’s ambassador to the United Nations often fights with the organization where he serves, especially as criticism has mounted over his country’s conduct in the war against Hamas. He’s just not used to doing it without the US in his corner.
title: Israel’s Embattled UN Envoy Hits Back Hard as the Gaza Crisis Worsens

description: Belgium may prosecute people for interfering in European-wide elections as part of an effort to combat Russian disinformation, its prime minister said Friday.
title: Belgium Opens Probe Into Alleged Political Meddling by Russia

description: The European Union’s drug regulator found no added risk of suicide or self-harm for people taking a popular new class of weight-loss and diabetes medicines that includes Novo Nordisk A/S’s Wegovy and Ozempic.
title: EU Probe Finds No Added Suicide Risk Linked to Novo’s Wegovy

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Iran Puts Everyone on Alert Over Retaliation Against Israel

description: US Senate candidate David McCormick led Bridgewater Associates as the hedge fund steered millions of dollars of investments into Chinese companies that produce fighter jets, bombers, planes equipped to jam enemy radars, and the country’s first domestically built aircraft carrier, according to documents analyzed by Bloomberg Government.
title: Bridgewater Grew China Military Investment Under GOP’s McCormick

description: Poland’s state prosecutors should look “thoroughly” into state-run Orlen SA following revelations that the energy group paid $400 million for oil that it never received, Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said on Friday.
title: Polish Finance Minister Urges Prosecutors to Scrutinize Orlen

description: President Joe Biden will forgive $7.4 billion in federal student debt in his latest push to provide relief to borrowers and deliver on a campaign promise to ease the cost of higher education as he seeks reelection.
title: Biden Cancels $7 Billion in Student Debt in Election-Year Push

description: The shipyard producing the US Navy’s new frigate has been hobbled by a failure to “achieve engineering and skilled workforce levels” for the medium-sized vessel, according to a service document on the project that’s now forecast to run as much as three years late.
title: US Navy’s New Warship Is Plagued by Worker Turnover

description: South Africa’s electoral commission asked the Constitutional Court to provide clarity on a ruling this week that allows former President Jacob Zuma to run for parliament in next month’s elections.
title: South African Electoral Body Appeals Ruling on Zuma Candidacy

description: China said its top diplomat used a call with Secretary of State Antony Blinken to condemn an attack on Iran’s embassy in Syria.
title: China Says Wang Yi Condemned Iran Embassy Attack in Blinken Call

description: A majority of Indian voters find the search for jobs has become difficult and their households are feeling the pinch from rising prices, according to an opinion survey published a week before elections kick off in Asia’s third largest economy.
title: Most of India’s Voters Fret Over Jobs, Inflation Ahead of Polls

description: Switzerland is heading for a popular vote on its neutrality after groups said they gathered enough signatures.
title: Swiss Activists Get Enough Signatures for Vote on Neutrality

description: Former President Rodrigo Duterte accused the US of inflaming tensions between China and the Philippines in the South China Sea, while criticizing his successor Ferdinand Marcos Jr. of supposedly doing America’s bidding.
title: Ex-Philippine Leader Duterte Slams US, Marcos in Chinese Media

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is embarking on a charm offensive with Beijing as she looks to shield trade and economic ties after pulling Italy out of China’s controversial global investment initiative last year.
title: Meloni Seeks China Reset After Italy Ditches Belt and Road Pact

description: President Joe Biden has added more Chinese companies and individuals to an export blacklist than any US administration, as growing frictions between the world’s biggest economies continue to complicate global trade.
title: Biden Surpasses Trump’s Record for Blacklisting Chinese Entities

description: The US plans to support infrastructure, semiconductor and nickel processing projects in the Philippines, as the long-time allies seek to grow investment partnerships after rekindling defense ties.
title: US Plans Chips, Nickel Deals in Philippines as Defense Ties Grow

description: Peru’s Congress overwhelmingly approved a bill late Thursday allowing workers to tap their retirement accounts, which authorities estimate could lead to $7 billion in withdrawals.
title: Peru Passes Bill Allowing for $7 Billion in Pension Withdrawals

description: Ecuador’s Public Prosecutor’s Office was asked to open a probe of former President Rafael Correa for alleged treason over comments he made amid a diplomatic crisis with Mexico, according to a statement from the presidency.
title: Ecuador Prosecutor’s Office Asked to Open Correa Treason Probe
